title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots cornerback Carlton Davis praises organization's player treatment, encouraging free agents to join the team this offseason.
New England Patriots reached the Super Bowl with key free agent signings like Stefon Diggs and Carlton Davis.
Projected salary cap space and coaching under Mike Vrabel enhances Patriots' appeal to 2026 free agents like George Pickens.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks 8th among Patriots' best free-agent signings with a strong first season performance.
Williams recorded 5.5 total sacks this season, including crucial postseason contributions for the Patriots.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million contract with $63 million guaranteed, marking the largest in franchise history.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major trades before deadline but may seek a minor roster addition.
Potential underrated trade target includes Nets center Nic Claxton, valued for defensive capabilities.
Celtics examining lower-profile players like Mavericks' Daniel Gafford and Kings' Keon Ellis.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Roadrunner Boston hosts the second annual Something in the Way festival, featuring two dozen indie and alternative rock bands.
Headliner Explosions in the Sky delivers a 90-minute instrumental set, using lighting for storytelling and emotional impact.
The Hotelier, based in Worcester, energizes the crowd and expresses gratitude for the festival's organizers and their high school idol, Explosions in the Sky.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced in a steel-framed, air-conditioned tent at Raymond James Stadium for Sunday's outdoor game.
The NHL constructed the tent to protect the ice surface from Florida's heat and humidity before the Stadium Series game.
Temperatures are expected to be in the 30s at puck drop, colder than the 2023 Winter Classic in Boston.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands gathered at Boston Common for the 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest against U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
The protest, part of a national campaign, was organized by local advocacy groups, drawing community leaders and activists.
Protesters demanded stronger protections for immigrants and an end to state cooperation with ICE, amid recent controversial actions.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people gathered at Boston Common to protest Trump's immigration policies and ICE actions on Saturday.
The demonstration, part of a nationwide series, was organized by Mass 50501 and other local groups.
Protesters marched in frigid 15-degree weather following a snowstorm, carrying signs and engaging in speeches at the State House.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox are considering adding a defensive infielder as spring training nears, according to ESPN MLB insider Jeff Passan.
Potential targets include Isaac Paredes from the Astros and Nico Hoerner of the Cubs, though trades seem unlikely.
Marcelo Mayer may become the full-time third baseman, with Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton rotating at second base.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots reached Super Bowl LX, surprising many after back-to-back 4-13 seasons.
Drake Maye, the Patriots' quarterback, led the league in completion percentage and passer rating during the regular season.
Drake Maye's father, Mark Maye, expressed surprise and acknowledged the team's fortunate advancement to the Super Bowl.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will broadcast his sixth Patriots-involved Super Bowl when he calls Super Bowl LX with Mike Tirico for NBC.
Collinsworth has provided analysis for four Patriots games this season, including pivotal wins against Buffalo, Baltimore, and the Chargers.
He previously covered the Patriots' Super Bowl XLIX win, marked by Malcolm Butler's famous interception against the Seahawks.
